channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2024061513
item.description:
Report X-2024061513

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-22
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was removed from trailer and placed on absorbent pad. four bottles were inside package and had loose caps which caused them to leak within the package. package was then moved into a yellow hazmat drum and brought to qa.

item.title: Report E-2024060478
item.description:
Report E-2024060478

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 7, 2024, fifty (50) 1-gallon jugs of UN3266 were damaged in a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3266-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All damaged jugs, spent absorbents and absorbent pads were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal. Majority of the jugs only needed their lid tightened and were placed into a CYB for future processing.
